N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6661.1 - Purpose and scope

State Regulations
(a) This Chapter sets forth procedures for administering, on a pilot basis, the

Combined Senior Citizen Services Center, Residential Health-Care Facility and

Child Day-Care Center Community Grants Program within New York State under
chapter 841 of the Laws of 1987. (b) There is a continuing need for
maintaining the aged in the mainstream of society by providing services and
opportunities for socialization and meaningful activity. It has been the policy
of the State of New York to increase the level of safe, efficient and
high-quality child-care services. The maintenance of qualified personnel in
residential health-care facilities has been of concern to the State; day-care
centers in the workplace have served as a means for acquiring and retaining
personnel. Therefore, this coordinated and combined approach to these services
is intended to assist the State in addressing the need for such services in a
manner that would be cost-efficient and of social benefit to the clients they
serve. The purpose of this program is to promote innovative and cost-effective
means of providing existing or proposed senior citizen services centers or
residential health-care facilities and child day-care centers in a combined
center. (c) In accordance with this
legislative purpose, the Office shall determine and take appropriate action to
ensure that adequate notice is given to the public concerning the availability
of funds for this program. (d) This

Chapter shall expire and be of no further force or effect upon the expiration
of chapter 841 of the Laws of 1987. At the time these regulations were
promulgated, such chapter was scheduled to expire on December 31, 1990. Notes
